Notes on magnetism - I

Magnetism of free atoms and ions

Posted on March 18, 2020, by Yuanpeng Zhang

To understand the magnetism of free atoms and ions, we may go through several stages, as follows, Hartree approximation - electrons are treated in a non-interactive manner. Beyond Hartree - interaction between electrons is taken into account. Spin-orbital coupling. Hyperfine interaction - the interaction between electrons and nucleus. [Read More]

A silent refrigerator

The working principle of Einstein‚Äôs refrigerator

Posted on December 8, 2019, by Yuanpeng Zhang

All refrigerators running with gas relies on the principle that the evaporation of liquid to its corresponding gas form will take heat from surroundings. After evaporation, the gas should be liquefied back to liquid form to finish the cycle, and of course, the process of liquefaction will emit heat. That‚Äôs... [Read More]
